Package demoworld.model

Class Hitpoints

Object
Stat
Hitpoints
All Implemented Interfaces:
Named
public class Hitpoints extends Stat
Hitpoints represents the hitpoints of a Character. It extends the Stat class and provides methods to manage the character's hitpoints.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    Hitpoints(int max, int current)
    Constructs a new Hitpoints instance

  • Constructor Details

    • Hitpoints

      public Hitpoints(int max, int current)
      Constructs a new Hitpoints instance
      Parameters:
      max - initial maximum amount for both the base Value and the modifier Value in hitpoints (the initial minimums are always zero for hitpoints)
      current - initial current amount for the base Value in hitpoints

  • Method Details

    • isDead

      public boolean isDead()
      Checks if the hitpoints state would indicate the character is downed.
      Returns:
      true if the current hit points are equal to the minimum hit points, false otherwise

    • damage

      public int damage(int value)
      Applies damage to the character's hit points. Damage is taken from temporary (modified) hitpoints first, then from base hitpoints.
      Parameters:
      value - the amount of damage to apply
      Returns:
      the new total hitpoints

    • heal

      public int heal(int value)
      Heals the characters current hitpoints (temporary extra hitpoints can not be healed)
      Parameters:
      value - the amount of healing to apply
      Returns:
      the new total hitpoints

    • setTempHp

      public void setTempHp(int value)
      Sets the temporary hitpoints for the Character. This can never be set to a negative number, if its given a negative number turns it to 0.
      Parameters:
      value - the temporary hitpoints to set

    • getTempHp

      public int getTempHp()
      Gets the current temporary hitpoints.
      Returns:
      the current temporary hitpoints

    • resetTempHp

      public void resetTempHp()
      Resets the temporary hit points to zero.

    • toString

      public String toString()
      returns a String representation of the current state of this instance of Hitpoints.
      Overrides:
      toString in class Stat
      Returns:
      String representation of the current state of this instance of Hitpoints.
